context_0.vignette: Heinz's wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.
context_0.prompt: One thing that Heinz could do is to
generation: reach out to friends, family, or community members for financial support
attempt to negotiate with the pharmacy or the drug manufacturer for a lower price or a payment plan
seek help from charities or non-profit organizations dedicated to helping individuals with medical expenses
try reaching out to various sources for financial aid, such as private health foundations, non-profit organizations or online fundraising campaigns

apply for financial aid or assistance programs through pharmaceutical companies or nonprofits, attempt to negotiate the cost of the medication with the pharmacy or drug manufacturer, or consider using generic alternatives if possible
seek out assistance from various sources
contact the pharmaceutical company directly
start a crowdfunding campaign requesting donations to help cover the cost of the medication
look for organizations or charities that help with the cost of prescription medications

context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.
context_1.prompt: One thing that Josh could do is to

call a taxi, an Uber, or a Lyft to pick him up and take him to the airport

call a taxi, Uber, or Lyft to pick him up and take him to the airport
call an Uber, Lyft, or a taxi to come pick him up and take him to the airport

context_4.vignette: Mary is about to go to her final class of the day when she remebers that there is a homework assignment that is due. Mary's mom accidentally took her homework assignment out of her backpack when she was making room for her lunch. Now Mary has nothing to turn in for credit.
context_4.prompt: One thing that Mary could do is to
generation: email her teacher explaining the situation and ask for an extension to turn in the homework
email her teacher explaining the situation and ask for an extension or permission to turn it in the next day
email or contact her teacher explaining the situation, asking for a extension
email or call her mother and ask her to bring the homework assignment to school if it's possible
explain the situation to her teacher and ask if she could bring the assignment the next day or send it electronically
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension to submit the homework assignment
explain the situation to her teacher, either before the class begins or during the submission time, and ask for an extension to submit the assignment
email her teacher explaining the situation and asking if she could submit the homework later once she gets home
explain the situation to her teacher, apologize, and ask for a chance to turn in the assignment at a later time

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad could do is to
generation: start rationing the remaining food and water among the group
begin taking steps to improve their chances of survival
gather his group and find a sheltered place to stay that could protect them from the weather
set up a signal to attract any potential rescuers
start a fire to stay warm and signal rescue teams
find a sheltered area to survive while waiting for help
start a fire to keep the group warm and signal for help
start a fire to keep warm while they wait for the rescue crew
start building a shelter using branches and leaves found in the area for protection from the cold and wind
start rationing the available food and water among them
